DOC.detailed_description: Primary Effectiveness Endpoint : Typical atypical GERD symptom elimination ( score ≤ 2 question ) clinically significant improvement ( ≥ 50 % reduction total score ) 6-month follow-up compare baseline . Secondary Effectiveness Endpoints : GERD symptom elimination clinically significant improvement 12-month follow-up , 24-month follow-up 36-month follow-up ; complete discontinuation PPIs ; normalization esophageal acid exposure ; significant reduction reflux episode ; heal reflux esophagitis ; reduction hiatal hernia ; safety support low incidence serious adverse event .
